mystery_attributes: Unwittingly featured forged artwork in her magazine
Was creating industry scandals out of desperation
Threatened to expose Penelope and Nova's relationship

events: Making final calls about upcoming magazine features
Preparing notes for confrontation with Penelope
Threatened to expose Penelope's relationship with Nova

value.action: confronting Gregory about art fraud rumors
events: Hinted at suspicions about his connection to forgeries

history: Was her mentor before Penelope's magazine became successful
Feels betrayed by Penelope's rising success during her own decline
Known each other for decades in art and fashion circles
Featured many artworks he 'discovered' in her magazine
known_secrets: Beginning to suspect his connection to art forgeries

history: Former trusted art authenticator for her magazine
Distanced herself when forgery scandal damaged Eleanor's reputation
Respects her writing talent but resents her role in Millennium's success
Plans to use her relationship with Penelope against them both

agenda.primary_goal: Save her failing magazine by any means necessary

identity.name: Victoria Blackwood
identity.occupation: Owner and editor-in-chief of Couture En Masse magazine

state_of_mind.worries: her magazine's falling circulation and the art fraud investigation

speech_quirks: frequently references 'the old days' of publishing
subtly insults competitors while maintaining politeness
